      • toShoot

        public boolean toShoot(int rowShoot,
                       int colShoot,
                       java.lang.String orientation)
        This method set values to start and exit node
        Parameters:
        rowShoot - is the row where the user wants to shoot
        colShoot - is the column where the user wants to shoot
        orientation - is the orientation of the shot, it will be "" if the user is not firing at the corners
        Returns:
        isFound, true if the start node exists, false if not

      • toDetermineInitialDirection

        public java.lang.String toDetermineInitialDirection(Node ToLocateStart)
        This method determines the initial direction that the laser goes when the user its shooting from the borders but not the corners
        Parameters:
        ToLocateStart - is the node where the user stars firing.
        Returns:
        the initial Direction that the laser goes.

      • toDetermineInitialDirectionatCorner

        public java.lang.String toDetermineInitialDirectionatCorner(java.lang.String orientation,
                                                            Node ToLocateStart)
        This method determine the initial direction when the user is firing on a corner, using the orientation and the node where the user starts firing
        Parameters:
        orientation - that must be horizontal or vertical
        ToLocateStart - is the node where the user starts firing.
        Returns:
        the initial direction that the laser takes.

      • Shoot

        public Node Shoot(Node ShootEnd,
                  java.lang.String initialWay)
        This method obtains the node where the laser goes out of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        ShootEnd - is the current position of the laser, at first its the start node
        initialWay - is the initial course that the laser goes
        Returns:
        the end node

      • toFindPosition

        public Node toFindPosition(Node currentNode,
                           int toSearchRow,
                           int toSearchColum)
        This methods search a node by its row number and column number, it calls the method that search in a row
        Parameters:
        currentNode - is the current node
        toSearchRow - is the row where the node i'm looking for its located
        toSearchColum - is the column where the node i'm looking for its located
        Returns:
        the node searched

      • goThroughRows

        public Node goThroughRows(Node currentN,
                          int toFindRow,
                          int toFindColumn)
        This method search a node in a row by its row number and column number
        Parameters:
        currentN - is the current node
        toFindRow - is the row where the node its located
        toFindColumn - is the column where the node its located
        Returns:
        the searched node or the final node in a row.

      • toLocateMirror

        public boolean toLocateMirror(int rowFire,
                              int ColFire,
                              java.lang.String inclination)
        This method determine if the guess of the user is correct or not
        Parameters:
        rowFire - is the row of the node where the user thinks a mirror is situated
        ColFire - is the column of the node where the user thinks a mirror is situated
        inclination - is the inclination that the user supposes the mirror has
        Returns:
        true if the guess is correct, false if not

      • verifyStateAtEnd

        public void verifyStateAtEnd(Node StartToVerify,
                             Node endToVerify)
        This method verify if the start node and the end node have been guessed already , if they have, mirrors are shown again, if some of them haven't, that node value is set as "" again
        Parameters:
        StartToVerify - is the node where the user starts firing
        endToVerify - is the node where the laser goes out of the matrix

      • generateRandomMirrors

        public void generateRandomMirrors(int mirrorN,
                                  int n,
                                  int m)
        This method generates mirroN quantity of mirrors randomly
        Parameters:
        mirrorN - is the amount of mirrors
        n - is the amount of columns of the matrix
        m - is the amount of rows of the matrix

      • toAddLinkedMatrix

        public void toAddLinkedMatrix(int m,
                              int n)
        This method create a Linked Matrix with m rows and n columns
        Parameters:
        m - is the number of rows to create
        n - is the number of columns of the to create
